data.title: CrossFit MINS Workout
data.text: Workout of the Day 26.10.2025 WODDAILYSWEAT For Quality 6 Rounds 3:00 Row/Ski Erg 20 Box Stepups 15 Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (24/16) 10 Ring Rows Sweat: 16/8 Train: 20/12 Compete: 24/16"
data.full_text:
Workout of the Day

26.10.2025

WOD
DAILYSWEAT


For Quality
6 Rounds
3:00 Row/Ski Erg
20 Box Stepups
15 Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (24/16)
10 Ring Rows


Sweat: 16/8
Train: 20/12
Compete: 24/16"

ai_explanation.explanation:
Workout Overview


Hey everyone! Today’s WOD is designed for quality, focusing on building endurance and strength through a series of movements that will get your heart rate up while also challenging your muscles. We’ll be doing 6 rounds of rowing or skiing, followed by box step-ups, kettlebell sumo deadlift high pulls, and ring rows. The goal here is to maintain good form throughout each movement and to keep a steady pace, ensuring you’re working efficiently without sacrificing technique.


Workout Breakdown


1. Row/Ski Erg (3:00)

  • **Technique Steps:**
  • For the rower, sit with your feet secured and grab the handle. Start with your knees bent and your back straight.
  • Push through your legs, lean back slightly, and pull the handle towards your chest, keeping your elbows close.
  • Reverse the motion by extending your arms, leaning forward, and bending your knees to return to the starting position.
  • For the Ski Erg, stand with feet shoulder-width apart, grasp the handles, and pull down while engaging your core, mimicking a skiing motion.

  • **Form Tips:**
  • Keep your back straight and avoid rounding your shoulders.
  • Use your legs to drive the movement, not just your arms.

  • **Scaling/Modifications:**
  • If you’re new to rowing or skiing, consider reducing the time to 2:00 or using a lower resistance setting.

    • 2. Box Step-Ups (20 reps)

  • **Technique Steps:**
  • Stand in front of the box with feet hip-width apart.
  • Step up with one foot, pressing through your heel to lift your body onto the box.
  • Bring the other foot up to meet the first, then step back down one foot at a time.

  • **Form Tips:**
  • Keep your chest up and engage your core throughout the movement.
  • Make sure your entire foot is on the box before stepping down.

  • **Scaling/Modifications:**
  • Use a lower box if you’re not comfortable with the height or perform step-ups without weights.

    • 3. Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (15 reps)

  • **Technique Steps:**
  • Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width, toes slightly pointed out, holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of you.
  • Hinge at your hips and lower your body to grab the kettlebell, keeping your back straight.
  • Drive through your heels to stand up, pulling the kettlebell up towards your chin, leading with your elbows.

  • **Form Tips:**
  • Keep the kettlebell close to your body as you pull it up.
  • Avoid using your arms too much; focus on your legs and hips to generate power.

  • **Scaling/Modifications:**
  • Use a lighter kettlebell or perform the movement with just bodyweight to focus on form.

    • 4. Ring Rows (10 reps)

  • **Technique Steps:**
  • Set the rings at a height that allows you to lean back with your arms extended.
  • Grab the rings and lean back, keeping your body straight from head to heels.
  • Pull your chest towards the rings, squeezing your shoulder blades together, then lower back down.

  • **Form Tips:**
  • Keep your body rigid and avoid sagging your hips.
  • Focus on pulling with your back, not just your arms.

  • **Scaling/Modifications:**
  • Adjust the height of the rings to make the movement easier or harder; lower rings make it easier, higher rings make it harder.

    • Loading and Rep-Modification Options


  • **Sweat:**
  • Row/Ski: 16/8 calories
  • Box Step-Ups: Bodyweight or lower box
  • Kettlebell: 12kg/8kg
  • Ring Rows: Adjust ring height for easier access

  • **Train:**
  • Row/Ski: 20/12 calories
  • Box Step-Ups: Bodyweight or moderate height
  • Kettlebell: 16kg/12kg
  • Ring Rows: Standard height

  • **Compete:**
  • Row/Ski: 24/16 calories
  • Box Step-Ups: Standard height
  • Kettlebell: 24kg/16kg
  • Ring Rows: Standard height

    • Strategy Advice

    As you tackle this WOD, remember to pace yourself. It’s easy to go out too fast, especially on the rower or ski erg, but aim for a steady rhythm. Break up the box step-ups and kettlebell high pulls into manageable sets if needed, and focus on maintaining good form throughout. The ring rows can be a great place to catch your breath while still working hard, so use that to your advantage!


    Let’s get after it, and remember to have fun while you’re working hard!

combined_content.title: CrossFit MINS Workout
combined_content.workout_text:
WOD:

For Quality

6 Rounds:

  • 3:00 Row/Ski Erg
  • 20 Box Step-ups
  • 15 Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (24/16)
  • 10 Ring Rows

    • Sweat: 16/8

    Train: 20/12

    Compete: 24/16

26.10.2025

WOD
DAILYSWEAT


For Quality
6 Rounds
3:00 Row/Ski Erg
20 Box Stepups
15 Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (24/16)

Sweat: 16/8

--- AI EXPLANATION --- ## Workout Overview Hey everyone! Today’s WOD is designed for quality, focusing on building endurance and strength through a series of movements that will get your heart rate up while also challenging your muscles. We’ll be doing 6 rounds of rowing or skiing, followed by box step-ups, kettlebell sumo deadlift high pulls, and ring rows. The goal here is to maintain good form throughout each movement and to keep a steady pace, ensuring you’re working efficiently without sacrificing technique. ## Workout Breakdown ### 1. Row/Ski Erg (3:00) - **Technique Steps:** - For the rower, sit with your feet secured and grab the handle. Start with your knees bent and your back straight. - Push through your legs, lean back slightly, and pull the handle towards your chest, keeping your elbows close. - Reverse the motion by extending your arms, leaning forward, and bending your knees to return to the starting position. - For the Ski Erg, stand with feet shoulder-width apart, grasp the handles, and pull down while engaging your core, mimicking a skiing motion. - **Form Tips:** - Keep your back straight and avoid rounding your shoulders. - Use your legs to drive the movement, not just your arms. - **Scaling/Modifications:** - If you’re new to rowing or skiing, consider reducing the time to 2:00 or using a lower resistance setting. ### 2. Box Step-Ups (20 reps) - **Technique Steps:** - Stand in front of the box with feet hip-width apart. - Step up with one foot, pressing through your heel to lift your body onto the box. - Bring the other foot up to meet the first, then step back down one foot at a time. - **Form Tips:** - Keep your chest up and engage your core throughout the movement. - Make sure your entire foot is on the box before stepping down. - **Scaling/Modifications:** - Use a lower box if you’re not comfortable with the height or perform step-ups without weights. ### 3. Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (15 reps) - **Technique Steps:** - Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width, toes slightly pointed out, holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of you. - Hinge at your hips and lower your body to grab the kettlebell, keeping your back straight. - Drive through your heels to stand up, pulling the kettlebell up towards your chin, leading with your elbows. - **Form Tips:** - Keep the kettlebell close to your body as you pull it up. - Avoid using your arms too much; focus on your legs and hips to generate power. - **Scaling/Modifications:** - Use a lighter kettlebell or perform the movement with just bodyweight to focus on form. ### 4. Ring Rows (10 reps) - **Technique Steps:** - Set the rings at a height that allows you to lean back with your arms extended. - Grab the rings and lean back, keeping your body straight from head to heels. - Pull your chest towards the rings, squeezing your shoulder blades together, then lower back down. - **Form Tips:** - Keep your body rigid and avoid sagging your hips. - Focus on pulling with your back, not just your arms. - **Scaling/Modifications:** - Adjust the height of the rings to make the movement easier or harder; lower rings make it easier, higher rings make it harder. ## Loading and Rep-Modification Options - **Sweat:** - Row/Ski: 16/8 calories - Box Step-Ups: Bodyweight or lower box - Kettlebell: 12kg/8kg - Ring Rows: Adjust ring height for easier access - **Train:** - Row/Ski: 20/12 calories - Box Step-Ups: Bodyweight or moderate height - Kettlebell: 16kg/12kg - Ring Rows: Standard height - **Compete:** - Row/Ski: 24/16 calories - Box Step-Ups: Standard height - Kettlebell: 24kg/16kg - Ring Rows: Standard height ### Strategy Advice As you tackle this WOD, remember to pace yourself. It’s easy to go out too fast, especially on the rower or ski erg, but aim for a steady rhythm. Break up the box step-ups and kettlebell high pulls into manageable sets if needed, and focus on maintaining good form throughout. The ring rows can be a great place to catch your breath while still working hard, so use that to your advantage! Let’s get after it, and remember to have fun while you’re working hard!
